revised_title: Transport Number and Conductivity Measurements of Colloidal Electrolytes: Benzidine Dyes
tldr: The authors conducted transport number and conductivity measurements on benzidine dyes to study their aggregation and micelle size. They found that both dyes have similar states of aggregation in their N/70 solutions, and the transport number of the negative radical increases with increasing aggregation. This research helps to understand the constitution of micelles in colloidal electrolytes.
